definition: (of an airplane etc) to fall to the ground and crash
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: In this case, auto-pilot mode is sure to crash the plane.
sentences.chinese: 在这方面，自动导航模式肯定会让飞机坠毁。

sentences.english: Aviation Agency said the helicopter landed for refueling in the crash.
sentences.chinese: 航空署说，直升机是在准备降落加油时坠毁的。

sentences.english: One pilot injured, one missing after aircraft plummets at NW China air show.
sentences.chinese: 西北飞豹战机表演时坠毁飞行员一生一失踪。

sentences.english: It said the navy and East China Sea Fleet were investigating the cause of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 海军和东海舰队正在调查坠毁的原因。

sentences.english: Swerving to miss them, he crashed, fractured his skull, and died.
sentences.chinese: 突然转向，以怀念他们，他坠毁他的头骨断裂和死亡。

sentences.english: The plane crashed 30 miles south of the city.
sentences.chinese: 飞机在离城南30英里处坠毁。

sentences.english: In 1963 a Lancaster bomber crashed on Wallis Island.
sentences.chinese: 1963年，一架兰开斯特轰炸机在瓦立斯岛坠毁。

sentences.english: We have news that the plane caught fire after crashing," Rohit Katiyar, a top airport security official, told Reuters.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到的消息是飞机在坠毁之后着火了。

sentences.english: The plane crash was branded on his mind.
sentences.chinese: 飞机坠毁的情景铭刻在他的心中。

sentences.english: It crashed in the sea, a few yards from the shore.
sentences.chinese: 最终，它坠毁于离岸边几码地开外的海里。
货车或坠毁的飞机，择一炸之。

sentences.english: It crashed, twice, in the 20 minutes I tested it out.
sentences.chinese: 它坠毁，两次，在20分钟，我试了出来。

sentences.english: He died when the balloon crashed in Zehlendorf, West Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 他因气球在西柏林采伦多夫坠毁而身亡。

sentences.english: The last part of the controlled descent will be a nosedive into the ground.
sentences.chinese: “可控坠毁”的最后一部分就是撞向地面。

sentences.english: An aircraft was crashed to pieces.
The aircraft lost power and crashed killing all aboard .
sentences.chinese: 飞机失去动力后坠毁，机组人员无一幸免。

definition: (of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc)/to mess things up
to force a plane to land
to fall into the ocean/to crash into the ocean
opportunity in a battle/fighter aircraft/war secret
to return to the point of departure
